pros:
Flexible hours
Lots of opportunities for students
cons: Does not pay as much as it should

pros: Family environment, friendly, team orientated.
cons: Low wage, must have a masters degree and even still looking at barely 40k a year salary, no way I could ever support myself, buy a home, afford health insurance, have children on my own. A lot of extra work with less resources to do so considering the location is rural.

pros: Students are wonderful and everyone really tries
cons: Lack of resources are at an unsustainable level.

job_title: Communication Project Manager in Greenville, IL
pros: Innovation, change, strong women in leadership
cons: work culture can be stifling

review_title: Not the Institution it used to be
pros: Christian, committed to transformative education
cons: Not fully inclusive, make poor decisions, don't value their employees.

pros: Great place to get some experience, but I wouldn't plan on staying for more than a few years. Greenville burns people out.
cons: The institution doesn't have the money to hire up to capacity, so low-paid employees are asked to take on quite a bit - and have virtually no incentive to do so. Turnover is high, and alot of important information falls between the cracks.

review_title: Solid work, lots of travel, decent pay
pros:
- Decent Pay straight out of college 
- Good work environment
- Lots of travel opportunity
- Free food
cons:
- Lots of travel
- Not a lot of room for promotion
- High expectations and expected level of success

pros:
Great working environment.
Professors are easy going.
cons:
The professors in the labs don't always inform the TA of duties ahead of time.
Poor pay.

pros: Quality people. People are willing to help you and will understand if you have a conflict
cons: Not many benefits compared to the same position in other schools

pros: Christian, small town, innovative, long Christmas break
cons: Low pay, frequent downsizing, frequently changing tactics

pros: You take away what you put in at this position. If you are a problem solver this is where you work on campus. Also great opportunities for full time work over the summer where you earn more and are responsible for more things.
cons: A lot of back stabbing at times. Posting on websites negative comments aren't beneficial to your peers that you work with. Emphasis on peers. If you have issues, speak with the people around you and come to their level. If you are a student worker, you are student worker, not the head of IT. That's above your pay grade.

review_title: Very nice people in Business School and I actually met one of best Deans.
job_title: Assistant Professor In Business in Greenville, IL
pros: I met very nice people as a business faculty. They are awesome and very caring. Everyone talks like friends and the communication is very good and I am not afraid to raise my concerns or questions to anyone including the Dean. I love my students and they work hard and are very caring.
cons: The GU is substantially under-paying its faculties and staffs, There is not sufficient insurance coverage.  It is a small Christian College so the resources are often limited. Driving to Greenville is exhausting sometimes unless you live in Town. Meetings start too earlier and it is very hard for faculties living near St. Louis.

pros: The workplace is ideal for college students because it offers flexible hours that work around your course work, you can request time off easily and suddenly, the people in charge are knowledgeable, and it offers the work experience you will need to have a real job upon graduation.
cons: Most of the workers at this position are very unmotivated.  The lack of motivation can sometimes be bothersome and on several occasions information was not conveyed properly from higher ups to the student workers.

pros: It is very straightforward work, with a lot of resources to utilize. It is a learn as you go type of environment so you get on the job experience.
cons: It is annoying that people I work with are getting paid to sit there and do nothing. People not doing their job is one of my pet peeves.

review_title: Good department in a meh organization
job_title: IT Student Worker in Greenville, IL
pros: My managers were excellent and the team I worked with was great (for the most part).
cons: Low budgets mean most employees are underpaid for the work they do. When someone quits or leaves their position is rarely filled. Lack of resources means run down computers and more work for grunts like me.

pros: The people are amazing. The mission is great. Family feeling on campus.
cons: A lot of turnover lately has left employee morale down and limited staff to do all the work. Pay is lower than market but in line with Christian higher ed.

review_title: Greenville College is an interactive work place that expects employees to buy into a life style.
pros:
Quality Equipment
Great Leadership Teams
Supportive Community
cons:
Strict Lifestyle Statement
Limited Exposure to major outlets.
Not much room for growth

review_title: Wonderful Colleagues, Resource Poor, Emerging Vision
pros:
Great Colleagues
Strong Commitment For Caring for Students
Unique Christian Mission
cons:
Lack of Resources
Acceptance of Mediocre Management
Decade of Leadership Transitions
High Burnout Potential

pros: Great employees who care extremely for the students and each other.
cons: Employees are tired and very underpaid.  Small organization with limited opportunities for advancement.

pros: Greenville College is a close knit community made up mostly of Alums who care about the mission of the college.
cons: The salaries are incredibly low

pros: Faculty are wonderful and will do anything for you
cons: Salary is terrible, not even close to what they should pay

pros: Great leaders, hours, enviornment, Christ-centered
cons: Salary could be higher for work volume

pros: Entry Level Position, student based environment,
cons: No diversity, Low pay rate, and tedious

pros: Chill environment, mainly get to hang out
cons: political and lots of weirdos
